definition: to confer additional titles on a nobleman

sentences.english: The various animals that were used also symbolized the rank of the officers who wore them on their garments.
sentences.chinese: 補子上不同的動物象徵着不同的官階等級。

sentences.english: He promptly directed the highest promotions and decorations for general macarthur.
sentences.chinese: 他授予麥克阿瑟將軍以最高的官階和勳獎。

sentences.english: The emperor gave me the highest rank in the country.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝封給我全國最高的官階。

sentences.english: Public procurator " official's rank " designs the administration getting on.
sentences.chinese: 檢察官“官階”設計上的行政化。

sentences.english: Though the county magistrate is a post of seventh rank, after all, it is an official appointed by imperial court.
sentences.chinese: 縣官的官階雖然只有七品，但大小也是朝廷命官。

definition: Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to comment/a point by point commentary
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
Western Jin dynasty 西晋 historian, author of History of the Three Kingdoms 三國志|三国志
place where the emperor listened to lectures (traditional)
